Reviews.Title: “Great for budget hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: broadwayjen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and I have 3 favorite things about Riverside Tower Hotel. -1- the price. Very affordable ESPECIALLY if you have 3-4 people and get a suite. -2- the staff. They remember me! I love that :) they are also always friendly and helpful. -3- the location. Peaceful, away from the chaos of Times Square, and just a few blocks from Subway. I always tell people if is old and more like staying at someone's house than a hotel, there are stains in the shower and on the carpet, but it is CLEAN.

Reviews.Title: “"Down at the heels" would be a wild understatement”
Reviews.Author: vitzrob
Reviews.Content: My kids called it 'sketchy', but that would be putting it mildly. The place is a dump. We have traveled all over the world and stayed in all manner of accommodations. I've staying in truly tiny rooms in Denmark, so tiny was OK. This place, though, was tiny, falling apart, and not even clean. Paint was peeling off the filthy walls, the sink was not entirely attached to the wall. The shower also was somewhat unattached. The cheap plastic shower curtain was one-foot too long for the shower, so you have to stand on it while you wash. The industrial-style toilet was loud. The towels were so thin they were almost translucent. The walls were bare, except for one cheap looking picture, giving the room a cell-like quality. Rather than a suitcase rack in the closet (there wasn't one), there was a gray metal folding chair. Very strange. Did I mention the front desk staff? Unwelcoming. Truly, she barely grunted a 'hello' when we arrived. She choked out incomprehensible requests for information as we registered, and seemed generally quite irritated by our very presence. Although the location was great -- it wasn't even close to worth it. Pay a little more and stay someplace clean and somewhat kept up. This place is awful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the solo traveller!”
Reviews.Author: ConstanceRoshko
Reviews.Content: I was looking for inexpensive accommodation in Manhattan and most of the places I chose had been fully booked. I came across reviews for Riverside Tower which were to put it mildly, mixed! I was a bit apprehensive about staying there but my experience turned out to be very good! My first impression was - yes - it is small. But it was also very clean and smelled fresh. The bathroom had been renovated and was bright, immaculate and had lots of fresh crisp towels. There is also a window you could open in the bathroom so it is very bright and made all the difference. The shower is very cramped and the sink is very small but what more does one person need? It was clean and fresh plus there was plenty of hot water 24 hours. The room itself is tiny but heck, this was New York! I had places to go and memories to make. The bed linen was crisp and fresh. The bed itself was very firm and comfortable. I slept well in my little room. I was on the twelfth floor and though I did not have a view of the river, I did have view to the back high-rises and during the morning, sunlight filtered into my room. Also, I was able to open the window for some fresh air. Another thing I noticed was that I didn't smell one hint of cigarette smoke which is an instant turn-off for me. My room had a huge wardrobe to hang clothes in with an open shelf at the top. I also had two drawers to keep my belongings in. All rooms come with a mini-fridge and microwave which was so handy to have. There was also a flat screened tv in my room with 5 channels. It is an old building. The lobby and sitting room are dated, quite grimy. Its rather uninviting at first and to be honest, I wasn't sure what to expect. The elevator which seems ancient makes all kinds of strange noises and takes a bit of time to get you to your destination. I was on the 12th floor so it felt like forever to get up to that level of the building. But my room made up for it! As did the staff. The staff members are so friendly and helpful. Many times they went out of their way for me. Mike, the night shift person, offered me use of his laptop as I was without a computer. He also helped me get my bearings after arriving close to midnight on the first day. I hadn't had dinner and wanted a snack so he directed me to the perfect spot for a quick, healthy bite. He ensured me I would be safe and insisted I take his number should I run into trouble. Another staff person, Samantha, gave me such helpful information and directions even giving me her subway ticket which still had time left on it to use. The hotel is close to some of the finest gems NY has to offer. It's a 15 minute walk to the Metropolitan Museum of Art and 10 minute walk to Central Park. It's literally a block and a half away from Zabar's, one of New York's famous food emporiums. All sorts of restaurants and cafes are within a 5 minute walk. I am a solo female traveller and even after 1 am coming off the subway, I felt very safe in the neighborhood. It really is a great place to stay; affordable, superb location (right next to Broadway & a good subway line) clean rooms and the staff are just great! I will stay here again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Merrill L
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in February 2012. We stayed in a suite, two bedrooms connected by a bathroom. Our bedroom had a queen sized bed which basically took up the entire room (in fact, you could not completely open the door to the room because it was blocked by the bed. The other room had a twin trundle bed (and only one person was using it, so no need to open the trundle). Each room had a tiny sink and mirror, and the bathroom had a small shower and commode. The room was clean but pretty worn looking...stains on the doors, multiple coats of paint, chipped baseboards, and old looking carpet. The TV in one room worked great, but in our room several of the channels were coming in pretty fuzzy. The mattresses were pretty firm (hard even), but the bedding was clean and fresh. No sign of any bugs. This is minimalist accommodations--basically just a place to wash up and sleep. But the price is very reasonable for NYC, the neighborhood is wonderful to walk, and the view of the river is lovely. If you're looking for an inexpensive stay in spartan conditions, this place is for you. If you want even a hint of luxury, steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Carol R
Reviews.Content: The lobby is shabby and the decor outdated. The lift a bit dodgy, but the room was a pleasant surprise. Although very small, I only needed a place to sleep, so the small room did not bother me. The room had been recently painted and the bathroom revamped. It was clean and serviced daily (although the sheets could have done with an iron). Very well situated close to the shops, train, taxis and buses. Ideal if travelling on a budget. Staff generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great view, great location”
Reviews.Author: Barbstravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with daughter and grand-daughter in one of their excellent value suites on the 15th floor. This is not the Ritz, it's a former dorm for Columbia University and rooms are pretty small - so don't expect expensive furnishings or luxurious beds. But for a home from home with fridge, microwave, table and chairs, en suite hot showers, and views to die for over the Hudson River, with excellent public transport on the doorstep look no further. Obliging staff and a great neighbourhood. A few blocks from Central Park, museums, 20 mins walk to Lincoln Centre: its quirky and great!

Reviews.Title: “NY's Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hgfact
Reviews.Content: Horrible--the worst dump at which I've ever stayed in NYC. Trying to save some money was a big mistake. The room was so small you could barely turn around in it. The bed was a trundle--you had to slide the bottom out to have room (barely) for 2 people to sleep. And with it that way there was literally no room to stand. Had booked it for 3 nights--left after 2 and lost the cost of the 3rd night (more than willing to do so just to get out of that rat-hole.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Susan A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our young son a few months ago and will be back again next month. The rooms are clean, the shower has plenty of hot water, clean towels and a fridge and microwave. Oh, and the view is fantastic! I requested a pack and play and it was already in the room when we arrived. The staff was super friendly. If you are going there for the decor-don't. Yes, the elevator is slow. Yes, the lobby hasn't been remodled, maybe ever. But come on-it only costs $100. If you want a clean, safe, comfortable room that is in the heart of the Upper West Side, it is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & good for NYC - Bon rapport qualite/prix”
Reviews.Author: Labatyd
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small & furniture a bit old but clean and warm. We had a view on the Hudson river and could enjoy the sunrise. The underground is 5 minutes walk and Central Park is approximately 10 minutes walk. Les chambres sont petites et le mobilier un peu vieux et modeste mais propres, suffisament comfortables et bien chauffees (hiver). Nous avions une chambre avec vue sur la riviere Hudson et avons pu profiter du lever de soleil sur la riviere. L'hotel est a 5 minutes a pied d'un arret de metro (qui vous amene directement dans le centre de Manhattan) et a environ 10 minutes a pied de Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay once again”
Reviews.Author: Karen5056
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at Riverside Tower. The suite was clean - new carpets, paint etc. Still a great price for NYC and such a great location. Bed a bit small for two and it is against the wall but there is a bed in the second room. Decent frig and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay On A Budget”
Reviews.Author: JR4049
Reviews.Content: We just got back to Ohio after a wonderful 5 day vacation. I have never been to New York City but my wife had been about 7 years ago with her mom and sisters and has always wanted to go back. This year we finally made it. She left the plans up to me and after doing some research, I discovered this great place to stay. In a great neighborhood in the Upper West Side, was this older hotel, located just two blocks off Broadway. Since we didn't plan to stay much in our room, we just wanted a clean, conveniant place to sleep after a long day of doing the tourist thing. We were not disapointed at all. The Riverside Tower was clean, provided great service and all of the staff was very friendly. We had a terrific view and a very comfortable bed. Nothing fancy but a great price and close to places to catch the subway or bus, shop and eat (try Big Nicks). We plan to come back next year and would have no hesitation in coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Puzer
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this fine hotel a dozen times and always enjoyed it. Great location in a quiet neighborhood, close to public transportation and to Central Park. The rooms are small but we never come here to dance in them; 4 people can be accomodated in the suites. The shower is hot and tempts us to stay in them forever after a long run (we come here for the NY Marathon). The staff is friendly and most helpful, the price is right and permits us to stay an extra few days. Deo volente we'll be back many times.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NHdog
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to NYC on a budget, this hotel is for you. My friend and I stayed here last week and it was great. We got a suite which was 2 bedrooms separated by a bath/shower. Each of our rooms had a vanity so we could get ready at the same time. It was small but clean. Quite frankly we didn't need any more room. Each room had a spacious closet with hangers as well as a bureau. There was also a microwave and refrigerator. It had industrial paint and carpet but who cares? It is bare-bones but you cannot beat the price, the cleanliness, or the location. It is in a safe neighborhood in the Upper West Side. You can walk everywhere - to restaurants, Riverside Park, the subway, Central Park, etc. Just know when you go that because it is a budget hotel, you will need to bring your own toiletries and hair dryer. My only complaint is that the rooms do not have a deadbolt - but even with that being said I at no time felt unsafe. The staff were warm and friendly. I will definitely stay here again and I have been recommending it to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: AChic
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are SMALL but I was expecting that from reading the reviews. My friend and I barely spent time in our room so we really didn't care. We just loved that we were in a safe neighborhood, had a private bathroom, clean comfortable beds, and a great view of the Hudson river/new jersey. We would walk over to Zabar's every morning for coffee and breakfast. It was delicious and cheap! Then head over to the subway on the next block. On our first day we walked over to Central park (4 blocks?) to eat our breakfast there. Don't stay here if you're picky. Stay here if you want good location for a low price!

Reviews.Title: “A Shock”
Reviews.Author: USImmigrationStinks
Reviews.Content: We echo all the last 3 writers they are spot on but the size of the room was a shock 12ft x 8 ft + sink, toilet & shower, however no worry at least we did have our own toilet/shower. My wife and I do not go anywhere to stay in a hotel, we use them only for sleeping and this did the job. We heard no dogs, there was no cigarette smoke and there were no bed bugs. Two blocks over is Zabar's on Broadway for breakfast with some restaurants and one more block to Amsterdam Avenue for bars, pubs and restaurants. The subway cost is $2:50 or $2:25 if you buy two 'rides' (2 people one trip) to anywhere. My wife's phone did not work in the US, however the concierge allowed us too use his laptop to e-mail home that we had arrived safely. Getting suitcases in and out of the subway (close at 79 & Broadway) is a problem, either push the Emergency Gate Bar or wait for someone else to, It's the only way.

Reviews.Title: “great location and neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: omar e
Reviews.Content: Having visited NYC for the first time in 1974 and a bunch of other times thru the years I guess I pretty much know the "hotel scene " in NYC. In one sentence till I win the lotto I will stay over and over again at Riverside. The staff was very nice and helpful. Even suggested a better way of transportation back to the airport. Yes I know is not the Plaza but there is a difference between price and value and I truly believe that that this hotel has the best value of all the hotels in NYC. I once paid 200$ a night in 1981 in a hotel worse than this one had to drag the bed against the door so I could sleep with some sense of security. This trip in the last week of sept 2011 the price was great and the 2 bedroom suite served its purpose and was affordable. So till I win the lotto I will stay here and when I win the lotto will purchase an apartment in the neighborhood cause is truly a great area . It is convenient to everything and Zabar is absolutely delicious . Right now I'm planing my next trip in the spring and no doubt I will stay there again and to the staff thanks for a great stay , Omar

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Safe Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. The price is right, the location is superb and the staff are friendly. I have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Riverside Tower Hotel, and couldn’t have been happier with my stay. The surrounding neighbourhood boasts vibrant bars, shops café’s and restaurants. There is a McDonalds a couple of blocks over, and plenty of places to eat, drink and watch sport on TV if that’s your thing. As for the hotel, it’s basic, but it does a good job when it comes to comfort. The price is very modest for New York rates, and you get what you pay for. Simple rooms with simple décor and furniture. I visited NYC with my brother, and we opted for the suite. This consisted of 2 rooms, both doubles. The layout is odd, but nice as the 2 rooms are separated in the middle by the bathroom. The bathrooms consists of a decent shower with good water pressure and constant hot water, and a toilet. There are sinks in both rooms, with plenty of soap and towels provided which were changed each day, along with all bedding. One room consists of a double bed, and the other one has a single which converts in to a double when expanded via a slide out bed which is tucked underneath. There is a TV in each room, and an air con unit which has both hot and cold settings which worked just fine. In one room there is also a refrigerator and microwave and a table and chairs for eating on. The hotel casts great views over the Hudson river if high enough, so when booking I would certainly make a request to be in a high room looking over the Hudson as you can see New Jersey from here, and there are some lovely sunsets if you are lucky enough to get good weather. We had a fantastic time in New York as always, and this hotel certainly enhanced the trip. If you are looking for luxury, then this hotel is not for you. If you are looking for a basic, affordable hotel in a safe neighbourhood, then I would certainly recommend staying here. If you are not happy with the hotel when you arrive, a full refund will be provided within 28mins of payment, so you can try your luck elsewhere. We did not feel the need to do this and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Thank you Riverside Tower. We will see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Like a flop house”
Reviews.Author: ratch64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were both in the Peace Corps and have stayed in some basic places. We checked in, went to the room and were shocked. It looked dirty, smelled like vomit in the hallway and was extremely tiny and very creepy. We had paid for the week and they refunded all but one night. We got out as fast as possible and found another place which was close by, affordable and normal. I can't believe that this place is listed by popular sites that search for hotels--there should be some bottom lines.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and the best location in Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: GKominami
Reviews.Content: Located in the Upper West Side near the beautiful Riverside Park. Every day I walked 2 blocks and had breakfast in the Zabars (gourmet emporium and bakery) to start my day. It´s the best place to stay Manhattan, in in a quiet and pleasant neighborhood. The staff are friendly and the rooms are perfect, with bathroom, tv and refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “...and now a word about atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeTravels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are native New Yorkers. We return for to play tourist at least annually and prefer to stay in the upper west side area. For many years we rent an apartment, other times we stayed in the Amsterdam Inn on 76th and Amsterdam. This year when the Amsterdam Inn was no longer available for short term stays due to a change in New York City regulations we were slightly panicked. Having hunted down reasonably priced accomodations in this area for the past twenty years we felt we had exhausted our options. We had read the reviews of the Riverside Towers (RT) and were put off. My wife and I travel frequently and know that there is a fine line between "worn around the edges" and downright depressing. Fearing the later we avoided staying at the RT for years. However, this trip to the city was going to be a two nighter and the alternatives to the RT are difficult to justify the cost. Our needs are simple: convenient, clean and quiet. Especially in a city like New York, a hotel room for us serves as only a place to sleep and securely store our belongings. So here is what we experienced in no particular order: The location is marvelous! Being across the street from Riverside Park is wonderful. Lots of green and open spaces. Looking beyond the park is the Hudson and then New Jersey. The view changes throughout the day. I found myself sitting at our little dining table just looking out of the window and enjoying the view both day and night. Entering the lobby I was impressed at how nice it is. "No so dumpy," I thought. The staff was very cheerful when we checked in (and throughout our visit). Our two room suite was located on the 13th floor so we turned to the elevators. Here is a word of caution. The elevators are very small and slow. The air is stale, so if you are claustrophobic be forewarned. As I mentioned I grew up in an apartment in Manhattan. Elevators and hallways have a unique feel in the city. Note quite confined institutional but not hospitable hotel either. Quite, drab spaces with the sole purpose of giving you a way to get to your usually nondescript door. When the elevator opened on the 13th floor, in a real deja vu way, I was home again. Now here is the key to understanding the RT...know this before you open the door to your room...this building was originally constructed as a dorm for Columbia University! Knowing this will solicit a understanding nod of the head when you first set eyes on the room interior. It explains the room size and configuration. For me, it allowed me to relax in the space and accept it for what it was and is now. True our room had seen better times. A broken bathroom door was heavily spackled over rather than replaced. Closet rods had years of painting that was scrapped away where the hanger moves back and forth. Air conditioners are old but functional. Hey, sounds like the typical vintage apartment in New York to me! So, two short thumbs up from us. We'll definately stay there in the future for our short fun trips.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Price and No Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Hilltraveler
Reviews.Content: Expectations for lodging are different in NYC than other places. If you don't alter your expectations, you will either pay much, much more or be very disappointed. Personally, my needs include a comfortable bed with clean sheets, a shower, toilet and air conditioner that work well, a safe and convenient neighborhood, and NO BED BUGS, or, preferably no bugs of any kind. Also, I want a private bathroom, and I try not to pay more than $150/night. So, knowing that those are my parameters will help you understand why I am giving this hotel a good rating. The neighborhood on the upper west side is a favorite of mine. I enjoy being somewhat away from the craziness of midtown and the Times Square area, and since 9/11/01, I really prefer being well away from the Wall Street financial area, too - at least to sleep. The upper west side is still a lot of fun, lots of really good restaurants, great subway stops, Central Park just a few blocks away - and Zabar's. We love going to Zabar's; it's a grocery unlike anything in Wisconsin, for sure. They also have an attached cafe with great bagels and coffee you can eat in the shop or take back to the hotel. I recommend a toasted sesame seed bagel with cream cheese for anyone wanting a real New York breakfast. Zabar's is two blocks from this hotel, a big plus in my book. Second plus: we were able to park for free on the street. This, however, is not easy. The first night, after arriving around 5 p.m. and driving around and around the hectic NYC streets looking for a parking space, we miraculously found one in front of a church! Take note: in New York City, you may NOT park in front of a church. I have no idea why. We did not read the signs correctly, and we got a $65 ticket. However, the next day we found a legal spot and were able to park for free the rest of the five nights we were there. Since parking in a lot will cost $35 - $50/night, this was a big savings even with the ticket. When we first entered the hotel, the desk staff had difficulty finding our reservation, but he did come up with it finally, thank goodness. He was very nice, but he had us worried for a minute. We took the tiny elevator - four people max - to our third floor room. Upon first seeing the room, my first thought was, "I don't believe this place does not have bugs." The lobby, elevator, and hallways look very old, not very clean, and rather dilapidated. The room, however, was clean - if you don't count dust in the corners and streaks of dirt on the wall pictures, and hairs in the dresser drawers. The important parts were adequately cleaned. The bathroom fixtures were clean and worked well. The sheets, though thin, were clean. The beds were quite comfortable. Our room turned out to be two adjoining rooms with a single bed in each room and a bathroom in between the rooms. We had reserved a double, and I do not think this was what they call a double. The young man at the desk said, falsely, that we had not reserved a double. But it worked out ok. Each single bed has a trundle underneath it, so you could actually have four people sleeping in two adjoining rooms. However, when you pull out the trundle, creating a double bed, the door to the room is blocked. (In the case of a fire, you would have to put the trundle away before getting out the door. Don't know how safe that is, and I wonder if it is even legal.) One of the single rooms had a small table with two chairs and a refrigerator and microwave. Each had a closet, very small sink, and dresser and tv. The air conditioners worked well, as did everything else. After settling in, we were really quite comfortable. The other lodgers were, for the most part, average, middle class, respectable travelers like us, as far as we could see, except for one eccentric but friendly old gentleman across the hall from us who seemed to live there and never leave his room - just kept his door partly open and talked on his cell phone most all the time. All in all, the hotel fit our needs well. I would go back here if it continues to maintain comfortable beds, bug-free rooms, and a "low" price. Almost every time we go to NYC, at least once a year, we stay in a different place because the prices change and we are always looking for something affordable.

Reviews.Title: “great location, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCondey
Reviews.Content: wonderfully located on upper W side, near Riverside Park, subway,Zabar's,... rooms are very tiny, but clean; so an OK place to stay if you're not planning to hang our inside very long. Also-our "suite" had great views of the Hudson. Recommend reserving a 2-rm suite if at all possible, so there's room to sit & havwe a snack. Otherwise, bed takes up the whole room

Reviews.Title: “Price and location work if you just need a place to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: Michael969
Reviews.Content: Riverside Tower was one of the most affordable options in Manhattan and turned out to be in a very convenient location - two blocks walk from Central Park and the Natural History Museum in one direction and to a subway station in the other. We spent most of our stay out in the city, so the tiny, tiny room with zero amenities didn't overly bother us. We just came to the room to sleep. It should be noted that we booked a room for 3 and got two rooms that shared a (tiny, again) bathroom. Both rooms were small enough to touch both walls with either hand while standing in the middle. One had a double bed and one had a single bed with another single mattress that folded out from underneath it, after doing which the two mattresses took up the entire width of the room. Wouldn't bring a wife or girlfriend here. Was glad that the staff offered to have us store our bags after checkout so we didn't have to tote them around the city all day before heading back home on the train. The storage room was quite dirty and had a heavy, unpleasant odor, but our bags were safe and secure when we came back to get them.

Reviews.Title: “First impression disappointing but hotel won us over”
Reviews.Author: nambyluv
Reviews.Content: Although my family was disappointed when they first entered the small, worn rooms, by the end of our stay even my 15 year old daughter commented that she liked the hotel. We stayed 4 nights in a two room suite with the bathroom between the two rooms. By choosing this hotel, I was able to get individual twin beds for my two teenage children and a queen bed in a separate room for my husband and me- all at a budget price. The hotel staff was very nice and the quiet lamp-lit sitting room off the lobby usually had 3 or 4 people working on laptops. There was nothing sleek or modern about this place but the staff was very nice and helpful. The two elevators were quite small but not busy. I was worried about staying so far from Times Square but found pleasure in strolling the streets on the Upper West Side- something I wouldn't have experienced otherwise. The trip to Times Square was about 10 minutes and didn't seem that far after all.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for reasonably priced hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: arapis
Reviews.Content: The Riverside Tower Hotel is very well situated, at a small distance from the 79th street subway station, in a nice and quiet area. The rooms are small and simple, but clean and with a small private WC/shower. Taken into account the high prices of Hotels in Manhattan and if someone wants to avoid hotel rooms that are dirty or with shared bathrooms, this hotel offers a good quality/price ratio. free WiFi is only available in the ground floor lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The very epitome of "grungy"”
Reviews.Author: Bloody_Mary09
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel about 10 years ago, and thought then that it was basic but okay. In the intervening 10 years clearly nothing has been done to the hotel--no painting, renovation, re-grouting of the tiles in the bathrooms etc. As a result the entire place feels profoundly grungy, from the peeling, dingy wall-paper in the lobby, to the black stains on the grout in the shower, to the brown mottling on the medicine cabinet mirror. And there are signs of more recent inattention, such as mysterious smears on a chair in my room and (most disgustingly) gum stuck under the ledge of my sink. Just for an encore, when I first turned on the hot water tap in that sink it ran brown. About the best things I can say about the room are that the sheets and towels seemed to be clean, and I finally figured out that the profoundly unpleasant smell was probably industrial cleaner. Oh, and the air conditioner worked, although the air it blew in smelled like hot dog grease. I will say that the desk staff was very pleasant and helpful, including allowing us to leave our bags in their storage room on the day we checked out. The storage room door was filthy, the room itself was filled with mounds of random dusty crap, and the door was open when we came back. But none of that was really a surprise at that point. We were willing to try this hotel because of a lack of bed bug reports, and admittedly we didn't see any insect activity. The probable reason for this is the plastic sheet on the bed, which makes sleeping a very sweaty affair. So I suppose if you really can't afford anything more, this option does have that one strength. But in future I'll spend a bit more and consider it well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: down_2_earth96
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 2 times in a row and have been pleased. The receptionists at the front desk are very helpful and nice. The elevators are a tad too small going up to your room. The rooms are very small, unless you get a suite, which is very nice, and very affordable on a tiny budget. The bathrooms are OK too. The TV works, but no cable or free internet. No room service or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel.Clean, quiet, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: quilting123
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 15th floor facing the Hudson river in a two bedroom, with fridge and microwave, private shower.Daily cleaning services.Grocery stores nearby .Quiet and safe neighbourhood yet central. Four stops by subway to theaters and museums. The only lack was dishes and cuttlery which was solved by the staff the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, but it is what it is! If you want luxury, pay for it elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: LukeyD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 20 - 25 2011. It was roughly $159 per room per night for three of us before tax, which is added onto the price on arrival. This is standard practice in some NY hotels, it's not a con. The woman on reception was nice and checked us in quickly. We had a room on floor 7 which was split into two. We had a double bed in one, two singles in the other, with the bathroom (shower and toilet) in the middle. Each room had a TV and a seperate sink, and one room also had a microwave. There was also a table and chairs. The rooms are a bit basic and tired but there's nothing wrong with them generally. The doors lock, the beds are comfy, everything works. They serve thier puropse well. The location alone makes the value for money of this hotel fantastic. There's a subway station two minutes away (79th & Broadway, 1 & 2 lines) that takes you straight to all the action in under 10 minutes. It's also right near Central Park and only a block from Broadway. Overall the place is great for people who just want somewhere cheap, safe and convenient to sleep and shower. If you spend any more time in there other than to do those things then you're doing New York all wrong anyway!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: grandmajan666
Reviews.Content: We just returned froma two night stay at Riverside Towers in NYC Upper West Side. Conveniently located, we had tried to stay there several times in the past and they were always booked! This time a room was available and based on recent ripadvisor's reviews we jumped a the chance to stay for only $80 per night. Well, the price should have set off alarms as to the quality of the room, and the lack of amenities. The hotel is old, old, old, and it shows its age everywhere. The tiny rooms have exposed pipes that are corroding, electrical outlets that are falling out of the wall, rugs that are "sticky" (with what I don't care to know!), and televisions that have to be twenty years old! The linens were clean, and we did receive clean towels each day. No sign of bugs. The staff were friendly, except for the evening of check in, and the location is close to a Metro station, 15 minutes to Times Square. I wished we had spent an extra forty dollars per night and stayed at a better hotel..we learned a lesson...you do get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Yael30
Reviews.Content: For those New York visitors who are willing to content with small, basic equipped rooms, this is a good choice for hotel in Manhattan. Located in upper west side, where you feel safe to walk alone at night, close to subway station and to many shops and restaurants on 80th street (dont miss Zabar, the great delly). Yet, Inexpensive for a hotel in Manhattan. Rooms are small and basic but clean and have all you need for your comfort, refrigerator and microwave. The staff is friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Good Neighborhood, Clean”
Reviews.Author: andrgtrr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the new years eve weekend for about 5 days. The staff is the friendliest ever. No bugs! The decor is old but you get what you pay for. The rooms are tiny. If your on a budget I would recommend it. There is a subway close by and a strip of bars about 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple and CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: pjwmtl
Reviews.Content: It is certainly not the fanciest hotel in New York, but it is clean and simple with courteous employees and no bugs! Be sure to take a suite which included two small rooms with beds, with a shower and toilet between the two rooms. On the Upper West Side, the location is in a nice neighborhood. You can't beat the prices.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Puzer
Reviews.Content: Again, as in many years past, we stayed at this, our preferred NY hotel. We like the location, the proximity to the metro, the view from our 12.floor suite, the easy availability of kitchen utensils, the friendly staff and the ongoing feeling of actually having a pied-a-terre in New York. The price is right, the nights are rather quiet, the sunsets are gorgeous, even a little kitschy at times. And, not trivial: after the New York Marathon it is a comfortable stroll home from the finish line in Central Park. We certainly hope to stay there again next fall (or earlier!)

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sptravelers5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Riverside Tower four times, with each stay being for a week. So we know the hotel and the neighborhood very well. We have had very positive experiences each time. We know of no other clean hotel in New York priced this low with a private bathroom. The rooms are very clean. We have never seen any sign of insects. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The daily maid service very efficient. The other guests are generally European budget travelers and quite congenial. The rooms are tiny. MAKE CERTAIN YOU GET A SUITE. They only cost an additional $10. Staying in a tiny double room would be very difficult for two people. With a suite you get two small rooms: one for sleeping, another for relaxing. You get two TV's, two sinks, two bureaus, a small frig, a microwave, a table and two chairs. The neighborhood, the Upper West Side, is one of the best in NYC. The hotel is right on Riverside Park and near the Hudson River. Within two blocks is H&H Bagels, perhaps the best bagel bakery in the city. Every night on our way back to the hotel we stop for our breakfast bagels. Also within two blocks is Zabars, a legendary NY food store and great for coffee and pastries. Within a few blocks are many great, moderately priced ethnic restaurants. Three block away is the #1 subway line which provides a quick trip to Lincoln Center, Times Square, Penn Station, and Greenwich Village. The hotel is very basic, the rooms are tiny. But it is a clean, friendly place to stay in a fantastic and very safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: AndoainArantxa
Reviews.Content: We have to say the hotel was much better than expected. We specially appreciated the kindness of the people at reception and the good location: close to the subway, to Zabar´s, to Big Nick´s, to Central Park...

Reviews.Title: “Much maligned gem”
Reviews.Author: richard_twineham
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in New York seven or eight times over the years and keep coming back to the Riverside, having been unfaithful with the expensive and cheaper alternatives a couple of times. My conclusion has been that you get what you pay for. I've become increasingly surprised by some of my fellow guests' complaints about a number of things: room size, cleanliness, comfort. I've never heard anyone complain about the things that really matter to me from a New York City hotel: location, safety and reliability. It's nobody's idea of a perfect room for the night but: the staff are great, I've never had any check in problems(reserve online through their own site -credit card but no deposit needed), the rooms are hygenic rather than pristine, it's a block away from the 79th Subway, a block away from Zabars, four blocks from Central Park and the lift works. If it sounds like I'm damning with faint praise, I'm not. You'll really struggle to find anything better for the price. Believe me, I've tried.

Reviews.Title: “NYC's best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: Belle56
Reviews.Content: I hope all the negative posters out there stay away so that there is room for those who appreciate a good bargain. Reading their reviews left me a little afraid of what i might find, but I once stayed at the Hotel Carter and nothing could be worse than that. I found the Riverside Towers to be more than adequate for a whirlwind visit to NYC. The place was clean, great location, elevator, wifi in lobby,close to buslines and subway. with friendly helpful staff, I had a suite which was 2 small rooms divided by the small but hot shower and toliet.. There were Tv's in both rooms. This room might be a little crowded for 3 adults equipped with a double bed and a single but fine for a couple. Remember this is a converted dormitory. The addition of a small fridge and microwave also made life easier. the best part for me was the view of central park, the hudson river and the NJ skyline. For the amount of time i spent in the room, there is nothing to complain about. i did find myself a little concerned about the locks on the door, they did not seem adequate but did the trick for me that week. I would not hesitate.to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: zehzeh
Reviews.Content: location & view are perfect, staff very friendly & very helpful, double rooms small, therefore suite advisable for 2. in short: quite simple, but absolutely sufficient

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: Anyanwubutler
Reviews.Content: Some people go to New York to stay in opulent hotels. I am not one of those people. I go to New York for its museums, theater, parks and ambiance. A barebones hotel is fine with me. Hotels in New York are crazy expensive, for the most part. This one is not. It is in a nice neighborhood, on the Upper West Side, just blocks from the American Museum of Natural History. The hotel is clean, the staff were pleasant, but don't plan on holding a party in your room, they're too small. But it was great for us and perhaps it will be for you, too.

Reviews.Title: “Sucks, but it's NYC...”
Reviews.Author: MiahSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Riverside Tower twice. Our first stay was ok, though our bed was so worn out there was a valley in the middle of it. But our last stay was really disappointing; we were offered a discount that actually meant an ugly, depressing room, so tiny we had to keep our luggage piled up because there wasn't enough room to either unpack or have the cases around the room.Walking down the corridor to the room when we checked in was scary and I was sure we'd find bed bugs in our bed. Anyway, the shower is good, the heater works fine and the location is great, two blocks away from Brodway and a subway station. But paying through the nose and having to settle for a crappy room is awfully offputting, though it seems to be the norm in NYC. Shame...

Reviews.Title: “Won't choose it again”
Reviews.Author: azonaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Good location.Near to subway to go everywhere.Narrow space, noisy, full of odor in the room and we guessed that was the spray to repel cockroach.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Puzer
Reviews.Content: For many years we've stayed at this hotel when in New York for the Marathon. Obviously, we like the hotel. It's well situated, close to the subway (# 1), eateries nearby. We always have at least one lox & bagle at Zabar's, 2 blocks away. The hotel has everything you need: microwave, ice box, fine beds and, if you're lucky to have a room high up, gorgeous views of the Hudson. While the single rooms are small, the suites are spacious. We always feel safe at the hotel and in the neighborhood. The staff is courteous and helps out with a smile. A bonus: when done with the long run we can walk home from the finish line at Central Park. Ah, the shower feels sooo good.

Reviews.Title: “University Dorm Rooms”
Reviews.Author: chan2406
Reviews.Content: When we arrived I think we (3 of us) were all in a bit of shock. The best we could say was that we would only sleep there. Soon thereafter my sister-in-law went downstairs for some towels and came back up to tell us that the hotel was an an old Columbia University dorm. Automatically (and it had been a long time since we had been in college!!!) we shifted into dorm mode. We were fine after that. The reviews you read are correct - the rooms are small, the carpet not particularly clean, there were never enough towels, the shower was small ..... But, there were great things about it: the price is great ($45 per person with a bathroom is better than the $30 hostel with 12 people you probably don't know - and I really like hostels), the staff are friendly, you CAN NOT beat the location, the air conditioners blow nice cold air in June, if you get a room above floor 6 you can see the beautiful Hudson, you are across the street from a great park (the best in NYC), and the River Side Basin Cafe is 5 minutes away - and the sunsets are beautiful, you are two blocks from Zabars, three blocks from the subway and four blocks from Central Park. We felt safe all of the time. Take a shot and go for it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One step up from camping and not as clean. The walls and windows were dirty and the floor stained and not vacummed.”
Reviews.Author: MdAnne
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent and the people are nice BUT the rooms were not clean or comfortable as advertised. The space could be alright if they would wash the walls of all of the stains, remove the dirty q-tips from the window sills, wash and vacuum the floors, corners and doorways. New carpets are in order for the rooms too! They did provide clean towels and clean sheets. I did not see any roaches or bed bugs. On the plus side,they also had free Wi-Fi-and good on-street parking Room rates have fallen with the recession, so check out other hotels rates. There are lots of choices now so you have options. I would not recommend the Riverside Towers.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back there again.”
Reviews.Author: xcheckPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: This place is not too bad. The price is right and it is a good location. Rooms are small but you are not going to be living in them, only sleeping there. We got there on a Thursday afternoon and had to ride arouond for about ten minutes before we found a parking spot. We got lucky and did not have to move the car until we left on Sunday morn. The only criticism I have is that the hotel doesn't have cable TV. My room had a small fefrigerator and microwave in it. I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: englishtourist99
Reviews.Content: My first trip to NY and had the misfortune to stay in this so called hotel. Dingy, dirty rooms that are tiny. Fire door was blocked by double bed. The fridge noisy and we wouldnt dare use it or even the shower. Tiny WC between rooms, and apparently a glamour photo shoot being held in the basement!! Couldnt get out fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget lodging”
Reviews.Author: tippytop
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind a very small room and some grunginess doesn't bother you, I'd recommend the Riverside Tower. It's in a good, safe location and my room had a really nice view of the Hudson River. The bed was comfortable - neither too firm nor soft. Perhaps it was a slow weekend, but it was very quiet room and I got a great nights sleep here. It was an easy walk to Central Park and The Museum of Natural History. Plenty of restaurants and a movie theater within a 5 minute walk. I'm glad there are still places like this in NYC where you can experience the city without spending $300-$500/night for a private room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad :)”
Reviews.Author: vegansweetie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riverside Tower Hotel for two nights while we were passing through New York. We had never been to NYC before and wanted to see some sights. We didn't spend much time in the hotel because that's not the reason we went. There were 5 of us and we had booked a double room -- a suite, a small bathroom, and a joining washroom in the middle. The lightbulb in the washroom wasn't working so we went downstairs to ask them to replace it. We also asked if we could have another cot. They not only replaced the lightbulb and gave us a cot, but when they saw that we were a bit crowded they gave us another small suit for no charge on a higher floor with a great view! We ended up not using it but it was a nice gesture on their part. For the most part, the place was clean. The only qualm I had was that the maid seemed to have been interrupted half-way through cleaning, but it was nothing to be very concerned about. Nice neighborhood, too. There were young women out at night alone who were NOT prostitutes, which to me means it was a safe area. We were right across from the Riverside Park (lots of dogs!), and very close to the theatre disctrict and some really great delis. I recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget who is interested in local attractions and who wants to crash someplace safe at night. Don't come here if you're looking for spa treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Tofl
Reviews.Content: We went to NY to do some serious christmas-shopping. As we had stipulated we didn't want to spent too much on a hotel, we choose the Riverside Tower. We had a suite, so each one of us had her own room-which was great. Otherwise the double-room could have been a bit small. The rooms aren't that big, but you have your own washing-basin and your own bathroom (which was THE major thing for us, as we didn't want to share our shower or toilet with others). The beds were clean-but I'm still not sure if the sheets were changed once during our one-week-stay there. The carpets are dirty so no barefoot-running-around! The towels were also clean if not changed every day-altghough we left a tip every morning. The heating was working so no problems with that. The people were nice and helpful (the guys a bit more than the bored-looking girls). Great was the view from the windows (ask for a room in one of the higher floors) and the location. The metro is only 5 minutes away, and the Central Park 10 minutes. The hotel itself is ok for a short stay if you don't want to spent an rediculous amount of money. But if you are looking for real class you might want to choose another hotel. If I will visit NY again, I would've to think about booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “beleive all reviews, bad and good !!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisathAthens
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week at the Riverside Tower Hotel. I am a budget traveller so despite the bad reviews, I decided to check it on my own. When I first entered my single rrom I was shocked by the very small size and how old everything inside it was. The carpet must had not been washed for at least 10 years, and the walls had not been painted for 20 years. A couple of hours later, I got used to it and decided that I was there for vacation and the room was alright to have a shower and get some sleep. Except of the fact that I was provided with clean sheets and pillowcases after complaining to the reception the 4th day of my stay, it was clean enough and towels were changed every day. Do not beleive the myths about cockroaches and bedbags, I did not see any . The location is great, only 3 minute walk to the subway station. The stuff is OK overall. If you want a hotel with amenities or you need to spent many hours in your room,this hotel is not suitable.If you need a place to get some rest , at a great location, with private bath at a great rate, choose this one!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a good spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: sofieRomford
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights, we got what we paid for, but I also got what I expected. I took bug killer with me but did not need it. The carpets had a few spills on them, but thats down to the previous boarders who obviously were not too clean with their habits. The room suited us after all you are in New York you only wan't to sleep and shower in there. Shower and beds looked fine to me. I would stay there again if I needed a couple of nights in NY town felt safer than I would have further down town. Plenty of places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: LudwigBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I hesitated about booking this property but after reading several good reviews and having Frommer's recommend this hotel in a newsletter as clean although small, I decided to try it. We felt uncomfortable just checking in. Perhaps the rooms on the other floors are clean but we rented a two room suite which was on the 5th floor. The smell of Raid as we got off the tiny elevator was so intense that we had headaches within minutes. The rugs were filthy. Not to mention that the so called "suite" is only connected through the bathroom which was the size of a small closet. The rooms themselves are probably the size of a walk in closet. I can't imagine how a family of four could possibly stay in one of them. Like one of the earlier reviews mentioned we could not stay and left after twenty minutes spent calling other hotels to find a room. It's no wonder that they charge your credit card when you check in although we did get a full refund when we left. You are really taking your chances with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Small, dumpy, but delightful”
Reviews.Author: Pereirra
Reviews.Content: The Riverside Tower Hotel is what everyone is saying. Small rooms, in need of renovation, miserably tiny elevators. But what you don't hear is that hotel is in a very upscale neighborhood, the clientele are mostly professionals and tourists. The rooms are clean. Let me repeat that. The rooms are clean. There is a microwave and mini-fridge in each room, the beds are small, but comfortable, and the water is hot in the showers. You have your own private sink, the staff is professional and attentive. There are no bums habitating the place, you get maid service, a wake up call if you need it, and the front desk will summon you a limo to get back to the airport. What's not to like? A former dormatory to Columbia University (I was told), where you can stay in your own room with a shared bathroom with another room for under $70 a night, in the upper west side in New York. You don't call this a dump, you call this a bargain. I take my class of college students to this hotel every other year to experience New York—and I've never heard a complaint yet. You are close to the subway, to great restuarants, to central park, to museum mile. If your sensibilites are easily bruised, better stay somewhere else. If you are on a budget—it can't get better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Absoultely the worst”
Reviews.Author: kysmimi
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel we have ever booked. We should have known it was not good when we walked into the lobby. Dirty and run down. The room was as bad...dirty rugs, awful beds and extremely small. Halls filthy. We decided NOT to stay even if we had to forfeit our money. Never, never would I suggest this place. We rebooked at a Comfort Inn that was more than acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Run........”
Reviews.Author: blackeyedsusan58
Reviews.Content: We saw the ad for this in local paper...We walked in we were traveling with another couple...We wanted to see the room first. Four adults could hardly fit in elevator. The "suite" was so small, old furniture, nasty shower and a roach motel in the corner....I was speechless and embarrassed because I had picked this place and had friends with me...The room was dirty, no mattress covers. Hadn't been painted in years..I wouldn't of stayed there if it was free.... Travelers from Akron, OH

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Deviza
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife and three children in a two rooms suite. I've read a lot of reviews on this site and was a little bit worried, but was surprised with the quality of the room. It was not like in five stars hotel, but it was clean, enough space for five of us, shower, towels, fridge ... The staff was also very friendly. Highly recommended (for normal people).

Reviews.Title: “Really small”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Eve
Reviews.Content: Booked Riverside Towers for 5 days during our visit to the Big Apple early July. Was a bit nervous after reading the negative reviews posted. Checked in, went to our so called "suite", and to be honest, it was more like a double room divided into 2 with an extremely tiny bathroom in the middle. Very cramped but somehow managed. The only unsatisfactory thing about the hotel is the shower. It was so tiny (the space) and we could hardly move. Other basic amenites were satisfactory (i.e. mini fridge, tv - wish there was cable though, hairdryer, electric kettle, microwave oven). It was close to the subway though (about 3-5 minutes walk) which made our commuting to and fro easy. All in all, I would only recommend this hotel if you are really really on a tight budget and looking for a shorter period of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep and sightsee”
Reviews.Author: Bloomfield_NMShearn
Reviews.Content: My stepson and I stayed here in June 08. We arrived at 1:30 am, the neighborhood felt safe. The room was the smallest I've ever stayed in, maybe about the size of our cabin on a cruise, cheaper grade of carpet, but saw no bugs and was clean, although less expensive sheets, spreads and towels. I didn't expect shampoo and lotion for the price. Ate in room just a little, but it helped save on funds. We both fit in the elevator with one bag each, we are both around 5' 6" & 5' 11", they are small, but you can fit more than one person in, maybe 3? There were only hand towels and bath towels, no washcloths and I borrowed the blow dryer each morning and returned it to the front desk. Ironed downstairs next to the front desk. I would stay here again for the price, and location, just would bring my own washcloths. I did call the hotel to update direction info from the airports and they haven't. The bus from Newark is now $15.00 each way not $10. We left out of LGA took the red line to the N or W to Astoria Blvd station and the bus from there. Would not have used the ice cube tray in the fridge though. SH from NM

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the savings”
Reviews.Author: WldExplorer
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Riverside Towers and never again. I was here for a week and twice cockroaches crawled into the bed with me. Maid service most days consisted of throwing the bedspread over the bed. The spotted, dirty carpets and dingy hallways are depressing. Its worth paying a few dollars more a night to stay at one of the nicer hotels on the Upper West Side.

Reviews.Title: “Obliged to pan this place”
Reviews.Author: letsgoawayNJ
Reviews.Content: You definitely get what you pay for. I didn't mind the small size, the location was good, I don't mind peeling paint or dingy floors, but I do mind being kept awake all night by radiator noise. Putting on my clothes at 3 am to go downstairs to ask about how to make it stop (apparently you can't, it happens in all of the rooms), and discussing with my husband when the earliest train home was so we could be on it is not my idea of a good hotel. Thank goodness we had a "suite," we ended up sleeping together on the twin bed in the other room (where the noise was less annoying). Bring ear plugs if you intend on being sucked in by the low price. Never again for us.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price or location”
Reviews.Author: KGN_7
Reviews.Content: My 12-year old niece and I stayed here right after Christmas. Having read some very mixed reviews, I was a little nervous, but everything was great. Yes, a little run down, but who goes to New York to sit in a hotel room? Plenty of room for 2 - we each had our own room and TV, with a shared bathroom in between the rooms. Each room had a closet and basin, and one room also had a table, chairs, fridge and microwave. Yes, maybe a little dusty in the corners, but the shower and toilet were clean. Beds were very comfortable. Great, quiet neighborhood, easy walk to subway, very helpful staff. I would not hesitate to stay here again - in fact I've already booked a stay in May for a girls' road trip!

Reviews.Title: “Repulsive”
Reviews.Author: HJ9111
Reviews.Content: Not sure if our stay qualifies as it only lasted about 15 minutes. We paid our money, went to the room, took a look, and then I called the front desk and told them what a DUMP and that I wanted my money back. The thought of being homeless in NYC seemed better. One look at the gummy floors, stained chairs, bedding, and yes folks, walls, made me wonder what time the roaches crawled out. I did not want to stay for a visit. I will say that they were quick to give us back our money...glad that I paid with a credit card...one that would have fought on my behalf had they not. Please folks, if you cherish your health and do not want to contract some sort of an infection by walking on the floor or touching something in the room...stay somewhere else....and don't even get me started on the bathroom (the low ticket price aint worth it).

Reviews.Title: “small is one thing, filth is another......”
Reviews.Author: MaineSheila
Reviews.Content: My son lives on 140th. My family visits about 10 times a year. We love NYC. We thought the location was great....BUT! Wow! Now understand, we own a small motel in Maine! We have experience with picky people. We read the reviews and altho some were negative, we know how some people can complain about anything! We have stayed at a plethora of hotels in the city, including the bare bones "Big Apple Hostel" which I would recommend to all for cleanliness, price, caring staff and location. BUT THIS PLACE.....UG! After reading their web site, I thought, okay, we've seen small and that is doable! We've seen old, and that is doable. We've even seen "not so clean and poorly maintained", and that is doable. But this place was filthy! I asked if they had cleaner rooms and was told NO. Greasy, dust build all around the baseboards and exposed pipes. furry walls from grease not being cleaned! Burn holes in carpets. Carpets haven't been cleaned in years! Garbage on bathroom floor that had clearly been there for months. And can someone tell me why, when people do paint in these old buildings, they paint over everything including outlets and light fixtures? And if you're looking for security, forget about it! No deadbolt, not even a chain! How can this happen!! It has to be against code! I know when the health inspector comes to our motel to inspect, she gets out the white glove! She looks in every nook and cranny! She always gives us a 99% and claims to have found something to keep us from that 100%. How can they even have a license? About the parking, I thought the web site was so cute the way they explained that if you just drive around, something will free up within 5 or 10 minutes. We drove around 7 blocks for 45 minutes to get a spot. It's not as easy as they make it sound! I wish I had taken pictures because the rooms surely didn't look like the web page pictures! I wish it was for sale so my husband and I could show everyone just how clean, cute and comfy a place like this could really be!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you love bugs!”
Reviews.Author: inmanH
Reviews.Content: Okay, my family and I first stayed at the hotel in July. It was in dumpy condition, but we loved the location and the river view, and we don't go to NYC to hang out in the hotel. We tolerated the stained carpets and the walls that haven't been painted in a million years, because it seemed like they at least made the effort to keep the place clean, and we didn't see any critters. We stayed again in October, and that time we killed a half dozen bugs over the course of two nights. I was freaked out, but since I hadn't seen any the first time I thought maybe they were just due for an extermination. I mentioned it to the desk clerk when we checked out. She apologized and that was that. I decided to give it one more try in Nov. It was such a great location, I really hoped they had done an extermination and all would be well. Well, no such luck. When we entered the room in the late afternoon, we immediately killed several bugs. I went right down and spoke to the desk clerk and asked if they had other rooms available. Since both bug experiences were in the corner rooms, and the non-bug experience was in the middle rooms, I hoped it might help. In fact, she told me she did have a complaint the week before from the same room but on a different floor. So, for that first night she offered rooms that had only single beds, which was not initially appealing to me and my husband, but after killing a bunch more roaches in the span of 5 minutes, we opted for the change of room. Single beds were better than bugs. We were told we'd have to change again the next night, which would have been fine, but we wanted some compensation for the inconvenience of having to move 3 times and for the overall ick factor. We slept uncomfortably in the single beds the first night, but at least we didn't see any bugs in that room, just peeling walls, broken tiles in the bathtub, and stained carpets. The next day I checked back in with the desk clerk. The manager offered us a paltry $50 reduction. We were appalled, so we opted not to stay the second night. We go to NYC almost once a month, and we stay at a lot of budget hotels. I know that roaches are everywhere, but when you start to see them hanging around your room, while the lights are on and you are present, it is a really bad sign. It is absolutely not worth staying there. They obviously don't care if they have repeat customers, otherwise they would make a bit more effort to address problems appropriately.

Reviews.Title: “tiny but decent”
Reviews.Author: summerrhi
Reviews.Content: Four friends and myself stayed at this hotel when we were in town for a wedding. At $150 a night for five of us, I thought it couldn't be beat. When we walked in the "suite" we thought, "How can we possibly fit five people in here???" It consisted of two bedrooms barely bigger than a queen size bed connected by a tiny bathroom. After the initial shock wore off and we figured how we would actually fit, the hotel actually seemed pretty good. It's in a great residential neighborhood and the staff was friendly and helpful. I've stayed at several places in NYC in the past, and this was probably one of the best deals. If you're on a budget and don't plan on staying in your room for much more than sleeping, then I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not awful either”
Reviews.Author: BlueL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riverside Tower Hotel for 7 night in Aug 07. Before leaving, I read the reviews on this site and was really worried. Unfortunately, I had left it too late to book anything else, so I was stuck with this one. When I arrived, I wasn't impressed at all. There was a very strange smell as you entered the lobby, which turned out to be everywhere else in the hotel too. I'd say the whole place hasn't seen a lick of pain in 25+ years. I paid the bill in advance and went up to my room. The elevators are tiny, but that didn't really bother me. When I went into the room, it was small, hot, run down, and had that smell that was everywhere else. I didn't really like it, but on closer inspection I realised that the room was just badly in need of redecoration. I wasn't dirty at all. The furniture was old, the paint was pealing, and there were no shortage of cracks in the bathroom tiles. But the sheets and towels were all clean, and I decided I could bear it for a week. I turned on the air conditioning and went off to see some sights. When I returned a few hours later, the room was much cooler, the smell was gone, and I decided it wasn't so bad after all. I stayed for the rest of the week with no problems. I didn't see any bugs, and the view over the river is superb. If you're on a budget, I don't think there's much better value in such a good location. If you are at all squirmish about run-down hotels, stay away. If you're happy enough to spend your time sightseeing and not worried about the room, go for it. I might shop around a bit before going here again, but I probably wouldn't mind if I had to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best price for a private bath”
Reviews.Author: wishingfor2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Riverside Tower for 7 nights. We loved our stay there. The bed was very comfortable. We got a suit, which is 2 rooms with a shared bath which they closed the one door off, blocking it with the queen bed and sold it as one room. It was nice to have the two separate spaces because if husband wanted to sleep, I could be in the other room watching TV. The room had a fridge and a microwave. It was great for saving money. The staff was friendly and although they say they provide tableware, when we asked for it, the gal had to go hunt it down. Kind of strange. They changed the towels daily, but never left the same kind or amount. They don’t provide any type of shampoo, or lotion, only very small bars of soap. The elevator is very small, but we never had too much trouble waiting. There is a bus stop right next to the hotel, and a subway (red line) 3 blocks away. The neighborhood was great and we really enjoyed the people. Tons of a good choice of restaurants within a few blocks and more then one pharmacy/store. We would diffidently stay there again if we go back and after a long day of sight seeing we always looked forward to going back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: fabdiesel
Reviews.Content: please don't stay here....horrible! I don't understand how these ppl can give this place an OK. The floors were dirty and filthy. The bathroom...that's another story unto itself...and trust me, when it says suite, it's not what you think. Doors didn't even have proper locks. It looked like one of those hotels where you can rent by the hour. And trust me, my friends are very adaptable to environments when it comes to budget...but they were even freaked out. Pay extra for somewhere that you can actually lay your luggage somewhere, rather than propping it against the TV on the bedstand. The only good part about this hotel was the location...79 st station was a literal 5 minute walk. But I would've rather stayed in Queens and spent an extra 15 minutes on the subway than staying here again....beware!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: harrisburton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riverside Tower Hotel in August of 2007 and I was pleasantely surprised. Sure this hotel is very small but having lived in New York City and also visited many times in other hotels I can say that all hotels in NYC are on the small side or less you shelling out 300 bucks or more a night. I found my room to be adequate size and I loved the fact that you have you own bathroom. Which is unheard of with a price as low at 104 bucks a night. Also, I agree with others who said the carpet was a bit old. It was old but it wasn't dirty. Everything was really clean and the hotel staff was very friendly which I found to be another great surprise because in NYC that is rare to find such nice and helpful people haivng lived there I know the customer service out there is non existing but not here at this hotel. If you are on a budget and want a nice clean place to stay with your own private bath in a really nice place in Manhattan this is the best place to say for the price and the location trust me...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: DebbBee
Reviews.Content: It's almost impossible to find a hotel room for 3-4 people in NYC for under $250 a night. The Riverside Tower Hotel met my family's needs very nicely. We spent $139 a night for a two-room suite with a private bathroom. We were able to park for free directly across the street from the hotel. The hotel had what I consider the most important basic features: great location, very close to a subway station, enough space for four people, air conditioning, reasonably comfortable beds, cleanliness, and a private bathroom. As some noted, the carpet was stained but that really didn't bother me. Everything in the room seemed clean. It was nice having a fridge and microwave. If you stay here, I'd suggest bringing your own soap because the hotel's soap bars are tiny. It would also be nice if the hotel supplied a hair dryer. Yes, the rooms are tiny. But the reason for our visit was to move our daughter into college, so we had a dozen cardboard boxes and various other items with us. Everything fit in the rooms just fine (with some creative stacking). Sure, I'd love to stay in a bigger room with more furniture and amenities. But I'm not willing to pay the price for that. So I'm planning to stay at the Riverside Tower again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I ever stayed in,”
Reviews.Author: Filaxou
Reviews.Content: Elaine from Portland, Oregon I arrived at the hotel after a nine hour flight, where there was no doorman or concierge to assist with my suitcase. The weather was very cold with rain & sleet. There is no food or even coffee on the premises. The room was very tiny with an equally tiny bathroom. Every night of my 3 nites, a woman from the room next door would leave about 11 PM with a good deal of shouting & screaming. The last day, there was no hot water, There was only one person on duty at the front desk whose only function seemed to be to collect the money in advance for the entire stay..thus, you were discouraged from checking out early. Oh yes, the glasses were plastic with plastic wrap & the soap was 2 tiny bars. The towels were small & thin but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean sheets, comfortable bed, but nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: LCluney
Reviews.Content: We read through many of the reviews on your site. We were prepared to see what we would get. It was as explained on this site. Very small, and not fancy at all. Yes, the rooms are cramped, carpet dirty, peeling paint and broken channel changer. But the beds were comfortable, the sheets were spotlessly clean, absolutely no bugs!!! Just a place to shower and sleep. Nothing else to do here. Don't stay in less than the suite size or you'll really be cramped. Staff was friendly, and location is fantastic! Only a few blocks from Broadway. The bus runs just a block away from here, and the subway only 3 blocks. We took the Metro bus from La Guardia all the way over to 110th street. Then we took the subway over to 72nd street, and we were there! Takes only 7 minutes to get from this hotel to Times Square. Very safe neighborhood, and quiet. Great restaurants all around here up and down a few blocks on Broadway. One word of caution: the rooms are not secured with deadbolts. They really need to install those. One night we woke up to hearing someone screaming at the top of their lungs in the hallway that they had been robbed. Needless to say we did NOT open the door for anything after we turned in for the night. Another morning, I went out one set of doors to go downstairs to use the ironing board and iron. There was a man, dirty, belly hanging out passed out on the stairway floor. I figured I could make a break for it if I walked fast. And I did. Asked the hotel staff to get him out of there as there seemed to be a homeless man on the stairs. They said he was living there and probably drunk. They did chase him away and told him he could not continue to sleep there. Would I go back? Sure, but I'd be very cautious about asking to stay on one of the upper floors. Probably not as many problems the farther up you go. I would not consider going unless I could rent a suite again. There were 3 of us in one room. The room was split into 2 sides. One side was separated by a shower/bathroom. The room had two outside doors to the lobby. However, the neighborhood is very nice indeed!

Reviews.Title: “bare-bones”
Reviews.Author: HowDue
Reviews.Content: lots of problems but very cheap, and seemed safe enough. Good neighborhood, clean sink and shower, dirty carpets, comfortable bed, elevator will fit 4 adults and 3 small kids on inhale. The reason we won't return is the very very strong smell of insecticide with no way to get adequate air exchange. Cheap is not enough.

Reviews.Title: “ohhhhhhhhh the horror”
Reviews.Author: ktravelMontreal
Reviews.Content: RUN FOR THE HILLS ...DON'T ,I REPEAT DO NOT ATTEMPT. BE AFRAID VERY AFRAID.I AM A TRAVEL AGENT AND I TRY TO GO TO A DIFFERENT HOTEL EVERY TIME I VISIT NEWYORK CITY WHICH IS QUITE OFTEN 5 X A YEAR. So that why I can see all the different hotels that they offer When I arrived the receptionist was a sleep with her head on the desk. I asked for the key to see the room first the elevator is big enough for 1 person of no more then I would say 180lbs 1 luggage.The rooms looked like something out of a horror movie.Dont stay here spend the extra money and get something clean and homey.I gave the key to my husband so he would not thing I was exaggerating he flew back down and said lets get out of here now !!! Your better off not going anywhere if this is your only option do not attempt.You will very very sorry.It's very down and I am surprised newyork city allows such a place to stay open . Kim*********Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: NathMtl
Reviews.Content: I often travel to New York for my job, so I don't really look at the prices when my boss is paying! But this time, I was on a budget with my parents. Found this hotel on the web, nice picture, good location. Indeed, location is great.You can also park your car for free in the street. First we got a room on the 11th floor. You will look at the photos. No more words are necessary. The sheets on one of the beds were not changed from previous guests. Since it was late in the evening, we managed but I asked for a cleaner room on the next morning, and was offered one on the 13th floor. More inviting, seemed cleaner..But I was glad we brought our flip-flops so we did not have to walk on the fllor bare foot. We saw families, couples..BUt definitely I will never stay at this place again..

Reviews.Title: “The perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker0129
Reviews.Content: Writing a new, updated review. We stayed again at this hotel for the third time without any problems. No loud noises, always clean linen and towels and very safe. Staff are always friendly. The clientele consists mostly of older couples, a couple families with children, and then a few young travellers like myself. They have renovated the upper floors a little bit so try and get a floor higher up for a less "crusty" room ;) oh, and no bugs! I have never seen a single bug in the 4 weeks total I have spent staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Saved a bundle in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Motowners
Reviews.Content: The suite was tiny--each room was 7 ft by 14 ft and had a sink (Room 75), bed and TV. The stall shower/stool separated the two rooms. Shabby but clean. The M4 bus is right outside (to Columbus Circle/then 5th Ave southbound). The #1 subway line is 3 pleasant blocks away. The only bug we found was a dead one. We saved around $800, and I've had a bug or two at nicer places. Not much to look at. Keep your expectations (clean, dry place to sleep) simple and you will be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “O>K.”
Reviews.Author: Amishcowboy
Reviews.Content: Nice Neighborhood. Good Price, Good Location. Very Small rooms and not in good condition, Former Columbia University Dorm. If you just want a cheap place to stay this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: jenworden
